title: Yureni Noshika à¶œà·š à¶¢à·à¶­à·Šâ€à¶ºà¶±à·Šà¶­à¶» à¶…à·€à¶­à·“à¶»à·Šà¶«à¶º  Meet the Drapers Season 6 Episode 8: Sri Lanka
description:
What an honor to serve as a guest judge on "Meet the Drapers"! Being a part of this global reality show with Tim Draper, a legend among Venture Capitalists, is unbelievable. My role was to ask questions from the talented young Sri Lankan entrepreneurs, from the angle of a customer. Among the best pitches, Lakshan Fernando stood out, taking the opportunity to represent Sri Lanka globally. Delighted to share our 4th place win.

I would like to thank the director and producer of the show, Sarika Barta, for this opportunity and for taking away my nervousness and keeping me calm before going on stage. Special thanks to Tim who spread humor and enthusiasm backstage to lighten the serious nature of the show. I also happily mention my friend Love Yadav, the other guest judge; We add magic to the show in our own ways.

Undoubtedly, representing Sri Lanka in a global reality show marks a milestone in my career and I am grateful for the opportunity and the life experiences that have come from it.

Full Episode :  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OtWdXcdY5Gg
Exclusively on : @DraperTV

title: Winning Moment | Best Actress - Yureni Noshika | SIGNIS Awards 2023 ğŸ¬
description:
Second 'Best Actress' win for this year! Thank you, SIGNIS AWARDS 2023, for an unforgettable night. Team Night Rider, I only have so much gratitude for all of you. Congratulations on all the nominations tonight, including Best Film, Best Director, Best Actor, Best Screenwriter, Best Editor, Best Music. I pray these acknowledgments will not only let me give up on my dreams but also help me move forward in life when the going gets tough. Shaani Suriyabandara (my character), you will have a special place in my heart. Thank you to all my fans for the wonderful wishes. I feel so blessed and loved. 

#bestactress #yureninoshika #nightrider #signisawards2023

Deshamanya Wannakuwatta Waduge Don Albert Perera (Sinhalese: à·€à¶±à·Šà¶±à¶šà·”à·€à¶­à·Šà¶­ à·€à¶©à·”à¶œà·š à¶¯à·œà¶±à·Š à¶‡à¶½à·Šà¶¶à¶§à·Š à¶´à·™à¶»à·™à¶»à·; 5 December 1927 â€“ 3 November 2016) better known by his adopted name Amaradeva, was a prominent Sri Lankan vocalist, violinist and composer. Primarily using traditional instruments like sitars, tablas and harmoniums, Amaradeva incorporates Sinhala folk music with Indian ragas in his work. With all the nonsense floating around and unnecessary panic we thought of sharing a few tips on how to stay safe from the Corona Virus (COVID-19) with a dash of comedy.

Poor telecommunication signals were a major hindrance to nearly 250 school and university students belonging to 200 families in Wadukanda, Othumba and Mahdowa areas. However, they are now continuing their education uninterrupted as this issue was recently resolved. Thousands of people in other parts of the island also face various issues, and are awaiting our support. Therefore, we kindly request your assistance in lending them a hand in any way possible.

title: Yuthukama -  Wasthi Productions
description:
To Donate  Click below link - 

http://kapruka.net/ranaviru_donation

We salute and honor the true hardship service rendered to the mother nation to save our country from 30 years cruel war. We give honor to these disabled war heroes by offering a opportunity to spread love and affection to their families.
There are thousands of disabled war heroes like this in our country who find it hard to spread the love to their families.
In recognition of their service and the sacrifice their families rendered to this country Kapruka.com and Wasthi Production opens the door for all of you to join hand with us to spread love for these loved once who has done their part for this motherland.

Kagoshima offers a rich blend of natural wonders, cultural heritage, and modern attractions. From exploring active volcanoes to enjoying local cuisine and traditional experiences, thereâ€™s something for everyone.

title: Glamping by offtrek | First Glamping experience ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡°
description:
#travel #srilanka #offtrek  #Glamping #mansaranna #asmr 

Glamorous camping or â€˜Glampingâ€™ is where stunning nature meets modern luxury! 
If experiencing nature with comfort is your style, Offtrek Geo Domes and the Pyramid Dome will offer you the opportunity to reconnect with the serenity of nature while enjoying all the creature comforts.
Our glamping site is located in a beautiful village named Mangoda situated in Hunnasgiriya, Kandy, nestled within the tranquil forest of Monarawaana with breathtaking views of overlooking the Knuckles Mountain Range, Madugalla Hills, Rajagala, Bambaraganoya Falls including Kataraya, Upper Bambaraganoya, Ellassa. 
Our beautiful, eco-friendly Geo Domes are fully equipped with AC, super comfy beds, upholsteries, electricity, toilet, and hot shower facilities etc. along with an outdoor dining area, a kitchen and a firepit. Also provide Food & Beverage and shuttle service if necessary. Our Glampers can enjoy the rustic charms of outdoor camping surrounded by wilderness without compromising on luxury or style.
Also we offer waterfall trekking through nature trails with hiking, and delicious authentic locally sourced meals around a roaring campfire to complete the Offtrek experience. And off-road tours to Meemure, Wewathanna, Knuckles 5 peaks, Kota ganga 7 falls, Victoria dam for venturous experience and everlasting memories.
Offtrek Glamping, an experience like no other!

title: John à·€ à¶¸à¶œà·„à·à¶»à·”à¶±à¶¯? | Awala Hela Camping | Part 2 | Bibila rock
description:
#travel #srilanka #hiking  #camping #mansaranna 

Camping at Awala Hela (Bibila Gala) - Unforgettable Adventure in Uva Province

In this video, we explore Awala Hela, also known as Bibila Gala, located in Bulupitiya, Uva Province, Sri Lanka. Rising to an elevation of about 850 meters above sea level, this breathtaking location offered an unforgettable camping experience. 

We were accompanied by an unexpected guideâ€”a friendly puppy that led us along the correct footpath to our campsite. After setting up camp, we cooked a delicious meal and enjoyed the panoramic views that stretched across the Uva region.

From the peak of Awala Hela, we had stunning views of many notable landmarks, including:
- Amune Hela
- Omunu Gala
- Hela Gala
- Walimbe Hela
- Oyamada Hela
- Wiana Hela
- Galoya Kadu / Uduperu Hela
- Ul Hela
- Nilgala
- Danigala
- Bulupitiya Hela
- Guru Hela
- Yakunath Hela
- Madolsima Range
- Madiagala mountains

Join us as we take in the natural beauty, experience the tranquility of the campsite, and enjoy the incredible vistas from Awala Hela. Donâ€™t miss this amazing adventure in one of Sri Lankaâ€™s most beautiful mountain ranges! 

#CampingInSriLanka #AwalaHela #BibilaGala #UvaProvince #MountainViews #SriLankaCamping

title: Sinharaja Forest Trek | Sri Lanka | Sustainable trek with Browns Hotels and resorts
description:
#travel #srilanka #hiking  #sinharaja  #mansaranna #rainforest  

We recently participated in a sustainable hike through the Sinharaja Forest, celebrating Nature Rainforest Day alongside the Browns Hotels and Resorts team. This experience allowed us to immerse ourselves in the beautiful biodiversity of the rainforest while promoting eco-friendly practices. The hike emphasized the importance of conservation and appreciating our natural surroundings, making it a memorable and impactful day for everyone involved.

title: Upper Laxapana falls | Abseiling with @ceylonextremeadventures3799
description:
#travel #srilanka #hiking  #camping #mansaranna #biriyani #asmr 

Hello ! à¶šà·œà·„à·œà¶¸à¶¯? ğŸ™‹ğŸ½â€â™‚ï¸

The Laxapana waterfall abseiling experience with @extremeadventures.lk was truly incredible. I chose them for their expertise and safety measures. The 126-meter-high waterfall, the 8th highest in Sri Lanka, provided a thrilling challenge. With newfound friends in our team, we embarked on this adventure. The abseil comprised two parts: a wall descent followed by a breathtaking hanging segment, where we felt the misty wind and saw the waterfall up close. After descending, a team member arrived with a kayak to ferry us to land, braving the icy waters. While the usual descent time is around 10 minutes, I completed it in 7, marking an unforgettable memory. I highly recommend this abseiling experience to anyone seeking an unforgettable thrill in life.

title: Moon plains | à·ƒà¶³à¶­à·à¶±à·Šà¶± | à¶½à¶‚à¶šà·à·€à·š à¶‹à·ƒà¶¸ à¶šà¶³à·” 10à¶¸ à¶¶à¶½à·à¶œà¶±à·Šà¶± à¶´à·”à¶½à·”à·€à¶±à·Š view point à¶‘à¶š ğŸ˜
description:
#travel #srilanka #hiking  #camping #mansaranna #asmr  #moonplains

Hello ! à¶šà·œà·„à·œà¶¸à¶¯? ğŸ™‹ğŸ½â€â™‚ï¸

Moon Plains, also known as Sandathenna, is a 400-metre long, 40 metre deep valley in Ranhawadigama, about 6km from Nuwara Eliya. What was once part of a catchment area, Moon Plains is now a notable Agricultural and Environmental Tourism Zone since March 2014.

Bountiful Wildlife

The green slopes and greying backdrop is something straight out of a portrait, with wild animals running about hither and thither. You can spot deer, buffalos and more at Moon Plains, along with dozens of bird species. In fact, Sri Lankan leopards have been spotted in this region, so you might want to keep your eyes peeled if you want to catch a glimpse of the elusive spotted predator!

Picturesque Views

Standing at a surface elevation of 6,200 ft, Moon Plains can get chilly and misty, so you need to watch your step! It also provides visitors with an amazing panoramic view of the countryside and peaks that surround it, but again, this depends on the visibility during the day. A key attraction at Moon Plains is the â€˜Mini Worldâ€™s Endâ€™, a peak with a sharp drop, offering you a stunning look at the landscape below.

Useful Information

The park is open from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m., excluding Poya days and other religious holidays, and the entrance fee is Rs. 400 per person, whereas a jeep can be hired for a 1-hour tour at about Rs. 2000, fitting in up to seven people. You could even take a bicycle up there as the terrain is perfect for cycling!

Hello ! à¶šà·œà·„à·œà¶¸à¶¯? ğŸ™‹ğŸ½â€â™‚ï¸

Peessa is a lesser known waterfall in the Badulla district. The waterfall has about 45 m height. This waterfall is also located in a jungle, but can be visible from the Peessa village and also from the school in that village.

The water stream starts at the Lunugala mountain range and it is a healthy stream even during a drought. It is the water resource to irrigate the plantations of nearby villages. It also has a mini hydraulic power station.

An important feature of this waterfall is the cave behind it. The opening of the cave is covered by the waterfall. But that cave is accessible by the foot path at a side of a waterfall. According to the folk stories, it King Walagamba had been used it as a security place. The steps in that foot path were built by using   large stone blocks. The villages believe it is a work done by giant people who lived in Anuradhapura era.

Haritha Kanda is a beautiful hill in Sri Lanka known for its scenic landscapes and camping sites. It's a popular destination for nature lovers and hikers. The name "Haritha Kanda" translates to "Green Hill" in English, which aptly describes the lush greenery and natural beauty found in this region.

In this video, I share my hiking experience along the Pekoe Trail and my camping adventure at the Haritha Kanda camping site. I hope you enjoy this video and become a responsible hiker who loves and protects nature. ğŸƒ

à¶¸à·š à¶œà·™à¶± à¶‘à¶±à·Šà¶±à·š à·€à·“à¶»à¶­à·Šà·€à¶ºà·š à¶¸à¶­à¶šà¶ºà¶±à·Š à·ƒà·œà¶ºà· à¶œà·’à¶º à·ƒà·œà¶¯à·”à¶»à·” à·ƒà¶‚à¶ à·à¶»à¶ºà·š à¶»à·–à¶´ à¶»à¶ à¶±à·à·€à¶ºà·’.

à¶†à¶ºà·”à¶¶à·à·€à¶±à·Š 
à¶¸à¶¸ à¶¯à·’à¶±à·šà·‚à·Š

If I tell you that these hectares of lush green paddy fields were once a battlefield, would you believe me? In this video, we will take you to the once war zone of Narakamulla Thoppigala.

We began our journey on a cloudy day, starting from Seruwawila, we noticed that as we progressed, the atmosphere changed nearly everything we saw reflected South Indian culture. The landscape featured flat terrain filled with cultivated paddy fields, and beyond them, a stunning mountain range. The scenes were picture-perfect.

At one point, we stopped to ask a villager for directions. A kind local uncle pedalled his bicycle and accompanied us to ensure we found our way. The roads were barely marked, and wildlife was abundant. Birds, elephants were spotted. This landscape is truly a paradise.

By evening, we reached the base of Narakamulla Thoppigala. We took a break there and discussed how challenging it must have been to fight in this forest. Accompanying me on this journey were two brave soldiers,â€ Loku Peirisâ€ and â€œCharith Aiyaâ€ Charith was injured near this area, and we visited that area on our way back. It was a heartfelt moment.

This journey continues as we pay tribute to our war heroes.

I hope you enjoy the video.

Greetings,  
I am Dinesh

If you're considering a visit to Mannar and wondering if itâ€™s worth the trip, I genuinely believe this video will provide the answers you're looking for. 

This isnâ€™t the typical portrayal of Mannar that we often hear about, marked by dry landscapes that make many hesitate to travel there. Instead, I invite you to discover the Unknown Mannar, a side of it that is truly breathtaking and unlike anything youâ€™ve seen before.

Have you ever imagined witnessing lush paddy fields stretching towards the ocean? For most, the answer is likely no. Trust me when I say, this isnâ€™t just a small patch of farmland, these are vibrant, lush fields, nourished not by salty seawater, but by fresh water from a nearby lake. Itâ€™s moments like these that remind us of the stunning beauty nature has to offer in Sri Lanka.

Throughout our journey, we came across the Modara River Aru mouth, charming fishing villages, and sunsets that seemed almost compared to non. Each of these experiences has reshaped and changed my view of Mannar, I invite you to add Mannar, this hidden gem to your travel list.

I sincerely hope you find joy in watching this video and that it will inspire you to explore Mannar. 

I hope you will enjoy the video 

Greetings,  
I am Dinesh

This time, I am embarking on a solo ride to Chilavathurai in the Northern Province of Sri Lanka.

I started my journey early in the morning, and by noon, I had passed Kajuwaththa through Wilpattu National Park. The ride was challenging, as it was entirely off-road and I encountered no one along the way. However, it brought back old memories and added even more great adventures to my mind. I am on a mission to find a place that holds painful memories from our history related to the war.

The ride will continue until I reach that place and contribute to preserving our history. I hope you enjoy the journey.

Greetings,  
I am Dinesh

à¶¸à·™à¶¸ à¶´à·’à¶±à·Šà·€à¶±à·Šà¶­ à¶‡à·ƒà·… à¶´à·”à¶» à¶´à·ƒà·…à·œà·ƒà·Šà·€à¶š à¶´à·œà·„à·œà¶º à¶¯à·’à¶±à¶ºà·šà¶¯à·“, à¶¸à·™à¶¸ à·€à·“à¶©à·’à¶ºà·à·€ à¶”à¶¶ à·ƒà¶¸à¶Ÿ à¶¶à·™à¶¯à· à¶œà·à¶±à·“à¶¸à¶§ à¶½à·à¶¶à·“à¶¸ à¶´à·’à·…à·’à¶¶à¶¯à·€ à¶¸à· à·ƒà·à¶¶à·à·€à·’à¶±à·Šà¶¸ à·ƒà¶­à·”à¶§à·” à·€à·™à¶¸à·’. 

à¶†à¶ºà·”à¶¶à·à·€à¶±à·Š...
à¶¸à¶¸ à¶¯à·’à¶±à·šà·‚à·Š.

In the final part of our journey to Seruwawila, we came across a hidden monastery in the quiet woods, Neelabappatha Saaya. It was so peaceful there and the place touched our hearts.

Along the way, we also discovered how Seruwawila got its name and visited a special place in the village that helped bring that story to life.

The next morning, we visited the sacred Seruwawila Raja Maha Viharaya. Built by King Kavantissa in the 2nd century BCE, this temple holds two sacred relics of Lord Buddha. The forehead and hair relics. Seriwawila Raja Maha Viharaya is one of the most important Buddhist sites in Sri Lanka.

Today, on this blessed Esala Full Moon Poya Day, Iâ€™m delighted to share this video with you. I hope it will bring you peace. 

Greetings 
I am Dinesh

à¶¸à·š à¶‘à¶¸ à·ƒà·œà¶¯à·”à¶»à·” à·ƒà·„ à·€à·’à¶šà·Šâ€à¶»à¶¸à·à¶±à·Šà·€à·’à¶­ à·ƒà¶‚à¶ à·à¶»à¶ºà·š à·ƒà¶¸à·Šà¶´à·–à¶»à·Šà¶« à¶»à·–à¶´ à¶»à¶ à¶±à·à·€à¶ºà·’.

à¶†à¶ºà·”à¶¶à·à·€à¶±à·Š à¶¸à¶¸ à¶¯à·’à¶±à·šà·‚à·Š.

In this video, we honor our heroes who fought to protect peace in my motherland. 

We took a ride from Seruwavilla to Thoppigala. The journey was challenging due to the lack of proper roads, but it was a peaceful and unique experience. The landscape was enhanced by lakes with fresh water, birds, and elephants, making the atmosphere truly captivating.

Thoppigala, also known as Baron's Cap, rises to 534 meters and is located northwest of Batticaloa in eastern Sri Lanka. It was the site of a significant battle between the Sri Lankan Army and the LTTE. Climbing Thoppigala is moderately difficult, but once you reach the top, you are rewarded with a breathtaking 360-degree view. 

This destination is definitely worth adding to your travel plans. I hope you enjoy the video!

Greetings,  
I am Dinesh.

This video covers an unforgettable bike ride nearly 300 km from Colombo to Mavil Aru. The eastern region of Sri Lanka is agriculturally rich these days; lush green paddy fields make our journey more interesting and memorable. Mavil Aru is a waterway that supplies water to some regions of eastern Sri Lanka. 

This waterway became popular because of the civil war activities on 21st July 2006.

Now itâ€™s all peaceful and a great destination to travel to. Lakes, rivers, and wild elephants made this journey more exciting than we expected.

I hope you will enjoy the video.

Greetings,  
I am Dinesh.

à¶†à¶ºà·”à¶¶à·à·€à¶±à·Š à¶¸à¶¸ à¶¯à·’à¶±à·šà·‚à·Š.

The finale of our Annapurna circuit trek is a moment I cherish deeply. In this episode, I want to share how we beautifully wrapped up our journey. We travelled from Muktinath to Pokhara in a private vehicle, and then from Pokhara to Kathmandu in a tourist bus. Every moment of that journey was unforgettable, we passed by vibrant fresh fruit stands filled with apples, apricots, and their delightful byproducts, all set against the backdrop of breathtaking silver mountain views. These memories will forever be engraved in our hearts.

I want to express my heartfelt gratitude to my incredible team who made this journey not only possible but truly special. And a sincere thank you to all of you for joining me on this adventure and for walking alongside me every step of the way.

Greetings,  
I am Dinesh

à¶†à¶ºà·”à¶¶à·à·€à¶±à·Š à¶¸à¶¸ à¶¯à·’à¶±à·šà·‚à·Š 
(à¶…à·€à·ƒà·à¶± à¶šà·œà¶§à·ƒà·’à¶±à·Š à¶¸à·”à¶±à¶œà·à·„à·™à¶¸à·”)

Day 12 of Our Journey, Worshipping at the Muktinath Temple (3,762 m)

In this episode, we will share our spiritual experience during the Annapurna Circuit trek at the Muktinath Temple, which is located at an elevation of 3,762 meters above sea level. This temple is one of the most popular destinations for trekkers in the Annapurna region. It is a perfect place to heal, express gratitude, and make offerings for the successful completion of your journey.

I hope you enjoy the video!

Greetings,  
I am Dinesh

title: Thorong La Pass 5,416mğŸ”º| Annapurna Circuit Trek | The High Pass
description:
On day 11 of our Journey, 
Thorong La Pass (5,416m)

The day we were waiting for, we got up with a 4am alarm and quickly prepared ourselves for the hike. The weather now is below zero and it is freezing. 

The Ice layers have built up and the roads have become ice which makes this journey more challenging than usual, But the surroundings yet keeping their unique beauty. 

After about good 2 hours hike we managed to come to our most anticipated destination, Thorong La Pass (5,416m). The place that most of the hikers embrace and celebrate. 

This day has given tears to our eyes as we have almost come to the end of our journey. 

I hope you will enjoy the video 

Greetings 
I am Dinesh

à¶†à¶ºà·”à¶¶à·à·€à¶±à·Š à¶¸à¶¸ à¶¯à·’à¶±à·šà·‚à·Š.


10th day of our Journey. Yak Kharka (4,020m) to Thorong High Camp (4,880m)

We experienced one of the harshest weather conditions today, Imagine the weather that you cannot speak anymore and your body gradually becomes numb, the water becomes ice, thick snow falls and the wind makes it more and more difficult to breathe. We experienced all of these conditions today. Despite the weather, this was one of the nicest days we spent on our journey.

The weather is frozen yet creating an unbelievable atmosphere around us thick layers of snow make the mountains stand more magnificently. 

When we finally arrived at Thorong High Camp Lodge it was packed with hikers all of them were around the chimney, waiting to get themselves warm. 

Tomorrow will be a memorable day of my life as we are passing Thorong La Pass.

I hope you will enjoy the video 

Greetings, 
I am Dinesh

9th day of our Annapurna Circuit Journey Shree Kharka (4,080m) to Yak Kharka (4,020m) 

The whole atmosphere is frozen, keeping a unique memory to remember. Once again this day reminds us that we are on the most beautiful hikes on the earth. Some plots remind me of the old Japanese series Oshin some remind me of Robin Hood, and these surroundings are picturesque, second to none. 

Please enjoy the snowy landscapes, crisp weather, healing soundings picture perfect nature. 

Greetings 
I am Dinesh

To the worldâ€™s highest lake, Tilicho Lake (4,919 metres).

Today was a memorable day of our lives. We got up early in the morning to the cold atmosphere. With all the difficulties, we started our trek to Tilicho Lake. On the way to the lake, the valleys, icy rivers, and snowy mountain peaks made this a picturesque place that we will never forget.

The Tilicho Lake was frozen but stood above as the highest lake in the world gloriously. Even though it was extremely difficult to stay there with the freezing weather and low oxygen levels, we didnâ€™t forget to raise our Sri Lankan flag as a symbol that two Sri Lankans had visited the place. I hope I managed to capture all these great memories in this video, and I hope you will enjoy it.

Greetings,  
I am Dinesh

ilicho Base Camp

Day 6 of Our Journey from Manang (3,519m) to Shree Kharka (4,080m)

Today was truly unforgettable. The picturesque trek, surrounded by walls of snowy mountains, beautiful river valleys, and unique nature reserves, makes this circuit one of the most stunning treks in the world.

We were fortunate to visit one of the most famous spots on TikTok and other social media the "Alpine Homes." These colourful cabins blend harmoniously with the natural beauty, creating a mesmerizing view. Itâ€™s true to say that we are walking through one of the most beautiful trekking routes imaginable. I am happy to showcase that this video 

I hope you enjoy another episode of the worldâ€™s most beautiful trek.

Greetings,  
Dinesh

The 5th day of our Journey to the Praken Gompa Temple (3,945 meters )

We woke up to one of the most glorious views in the entire Annapurna trek. The temperature was still below zero degrees, but the sun had risen gloriously above the snowy mountains, making the Annapurna, Tilicho, and Gangapurna mountain ranges visible to our naked eyes. We couldnâ€™t stop staring at the view; it was that beautiful.

We got ourselves ready for the trek, packed sufficient water and biscuit packets in our backpacks, and started our trek. We started our trek with a heart full of gratitude to Mother Nature. As we ascended, the views reminded me of a fairy tale. Old villages, snowy mountain walls, multicoloured lodges, what a beautiful creation it has naturally made. Believe me, This stunning landscape took my breath away.

Passing horse stables, shepherds with sheep flocks, and donkeys, we slowly climbed to the top of the mountain where the temple Praken Gompa is situated. From the top, Tanzi Point is an orange-coloured building from a distance, he told us that he is not interested in going, but if we want, we can. We were curious to know what was there, and he told us that in ancient days, it was a place to sacrifice lives for rituals. The story made us think about that place. The story is in the video. 

I hope you will enjoy the video.

Greetings,
I am Dinesh

4th Day of our journey from Pisang (3,250m)to Manang (3,519m) Upper Pisang trek 

We woke up to a chilled morning it was refreshing when we opened the window it was a breathtaking view of the Marsyangdi valley. 

After getting ready and having breakfast accompanied by Potatoes with cheese and chicken noodle soup we checked out from the cottage and started our journey. 

The upper Manang trek is most definitely surrounded by one of the most breathtaking views. Old villages, stone walls, and roofs made out of wood chips make this trek a unique one. After trekking for a few hours we saw this beautiful lake consisting of green water. The lake is called Green Lake because of the colour of its water. We stayed there for a few minutes to enjoy the view and started our trek again. 

Our next stop was the Ghyaru temple. A small but yet peaceful temple in the Gayaru village. After stopping for our lunch we continued our journey to Manang. The wind got suddenly strong and the breeze was freezing towards Manang. 

After completing almost 27km we stopped at our next lodge in Manang. We quickly went to bed after our dinner as it was freezing. The next day will be a new adventure. I hope you will enjoy the video 

Greetings 
I am Dinesh

à¶†à¶ºà·”à¶¶à·à·€à¶±à·Š à¶¸à¶¸ à¶¯à·’à¶±à·šà·‚à·Š.

On the 3rd day of our journey from Chame (2,670 m) to Pisang (3,250 m),

Despite the freezing weather, we quickly woke up and got ourselves ready for the 3rd day of our journey. After finishing our breakfast of Tibetan bread with soup, we started our journey, thinking that these steps we once took wouldnâ€™t be returning, as we wouldnâ€™t be taking the same route on our return.

The colourful Marshyangdi River, paths with multicoloured stones, blue mountains, and pine trees make this trek one of the most spectacular, yet challenging hikes in the world.

I must say that this hike is a challenging one, but with the blink of an eye, our grievances are washed away by the beauty of nature.

Along the way, we passed an apple orchard and an apple wine brewery. Even though it was not the season, we managed to eat a few fresh apples on our way. We stopped in a small cafÃ© for our lunch and made it to our destination, Pisang, before sunset.

Pisang Lodge was surrounded by mountains; when we opened our room window, there were breathtaking views of snowy mountains. We quickly finished our dinner and went to bed, as we must sleep to dream again about the mesmerizing world we live in.

I hope you will enjoy the video.

Greetings,  
I am Dinesh

"à¶…à¶±à·Šà¶±à·à¶´à·–à¶»à·Šà¶« à·ƒà¶»à·Šà¶šà·’à¶§à·Š" à¶œà¶¸à¶±à·Š à¶¸à¶œ à¶½à·à¶šà¶ºà·š à·ƒà·œà¶³à·”à¶»à·”à¶­à¶¸ à·ƒà·„ à·ƒà¶‚à¶ à·à¶»à¶šà¶ºà¶±à·Šà¶œà·š à·€à·à¶©à·’à¶¸ à¶…à·€à¶°à·à¶±à¶ºà¶§ à¶´à·à¶­à·Šâ€à¶» à·€à·“à¶¸à¶§ à¶¸à·š à·ƒà·œà¶¯à·”à¶»à·” à·ƒà·œà¶¶à·à¶¯à·„à¶¸à·š à¶´à·’à·„à·’à¶§à·“à¶¸à·Š à·ƒà·„ à·„à·à¶© à¶œà·à¶±à·Šà·€à·“à¶¸à·Š à¶±à·’à¶»à¶±à·Šà¶­à¶»à¶ºà·™à¶±à·Šà¶¸ à·„à·šà¶­à·” à·ƒà·à¶°à¶š à·€à·“ à¶­à·’à¶¶à·™à¶± à¶¶à·à·€à·Š à¶¸à·š à·€à¶± à·€à·’à¶§ à¶…à¶´ à·„à¶§ à·€à·à¶§à·„à·™à¶±à·Šà¶±à¶§ à¶´à¶§à¶±à·Š à¶œà·™à¶± à¶­à·’à¶¶à·š.

à¶¸à·š à¶…à¶´ à·€à·’à¶¯à·’ à·ƒà·œà¶¯à·”à¶»à·” à¶…à¶­à·Šà¶¯à·à¶šà·“à¶¸à·Š à¶¸à·à¶½à·à·€à·š à¶»à·–à¶´ à¶»à¶ à¶±à·à·€à¶ºà·’.

à¶†à¶ºà·”à¶¶à·à·€à¶±à·Š à¶¸à¶¸ à¶¯à·’à¶±à·šà·‚à·Š.


The second day of our Journey. Dharapani (1,860m) to Chame(2,670m)

We woke up to the cold, refreshing air in the Dharapani cottage, coming out of our cottage it was a breathtaking snowy mountain range. For breakfast, we had Tibetan traditional bread and chicken soup which was a unique experience. After finishing our breakfast we started our trek through beautiful and colourful villages which were silent yet beautiful. 

On the trails, we saw Lokta bushes which the Japanese government and Nepali government utilised to print their Money notes and administrative purposes. The trail is indeed a beautiful one! Waterfalls, rivers with crystal clear blue waters, trees with hanging mosses, snowy mountains and colourful villages made this trail one of the most beautiful and challenging treks in the World. I must say that this is an unforgettable experience. 
We had our lunch in a small cafe and continued our journey till Chame. 

I am sure that our next day will be another brand-new experience. With that in mind, we went to sleep in our cosy cottage. I hope you will enjoy the video 

Greetings,
I am Dinesh

à¶†à¶ºà·”à¶¶à·à·€à¶±à·Š à¶¸à¶¸ à¶¯à·’à¶±à·šà·‚à·Š 

Imagine walking on,  one of the most beautiful and challenging hikes in the world. This is it. This is the beginning of the journey, Annapurna circuit which is known as the most beautiful and challenging hikes in the world. 

This first video showcases the first day of the journey, from Kathmandu to Dharapani. It was a difficult, but memorable experience. We took a tourist bus from Kathmandu to Besisahar (2,490 ft)for around eight hours, and from there we took a private vehicle to Dharapani (6,100 ft). 

The weather had changed and it was cold in Dharapani when we arrived. Our first night in Dharapani was a chilled night, which reminded us that this would be getting worse as ascending. 

Tomorrow morning we will be starting our trek.. Stay tuned to watch the amazing full series of the Annapurna circuit. 

I hope you will enjoy the video. 

Greetings,
I am Dinesh

This is a heartfelt story about the beautiful tradition of Sri Lankan drums. Weâ€™ve made the wonderful decision to visit a special place where we can witness the meticulous, step-by-step process of how these traditional drums are crafted.

This journey into the world of drums is not just a craft; itâ€™s a vital part of our Sri Lankan heritage that deserves to be cherished and passed down to future generations. Instruments like the Gata Bera, Yak Bera, Thammattama, and Dauwla hold significant meaning in our culture and spiritual life, weaving a rich tapestry of history and emotion.

In this video, youâ€™ll get a glimpse of the incredible craftsmanship and the materials that skilled artists use to create these magnificent drums. The dedication and countless hours they invest in each piece is truly awe-inspiring. The depth of expertise and knowledge possessed by the artisans in this workshop is remarkable, and it speaks to their passion for this craft.

If youâ€™re considering purchasing a traditional or custom-made Sri Lankan drum, I wholeheartedly recommend a visit to â€œKalakethaâ€ in Dambadeniya. You can reach them at +94779695147. 

I genuinely hope this video allows you to experience something truly unique and touches your heart as much as it did mine.

Greetings,  
I am Dinesh

title: Kirindi ella | à¶šà·’à¶»à·’à¶¯à·’ à¶‡à¶½à·Šà¶½ | à·€à·à·ƒà·Šà·ƒ à¶šà·à¶½à·™à¶§ à¶¯à·™à¶œà·œà¶© à¶­à¶½à· à¶ºà¶± à·ƒà·œà¶¯à·”à¶»à·” à¶¯à·’à¶º à¶‡à¶½à·Šà¶½à¶š à¶¸à·”à¶¯à·”à¶±à·™ à¶‰à¶¯à¶±à·Š |  4K
description:
Our journey concludes with the breathtaking Kirindi Ella Falls, a hidden gem in Sri Lankaâ€™s hill country. Rising to the top of the falls was an unforgettable adventure, with lush greenery and cascading waters accompanying us every step of the way. The view from the top was simply magnificent, offering a sweeping panorama of the surrounding valleys and mountains.

Kirindi Ella, standing at approximately 116 meters tall, is one of the tallest and most stunning waterfalls in Sri Lanka. Located in the Ratnapura District, it holds a rich history and a mystical charm, often surrounded by local legends. Its crystal-clear water nourishes the lush vegetation around it, making the site a serene escape for nature lovers and adventurers alike.

This marks the final chapter of our incredible waterfall-hunting series. Thank you for joining us on this journey of discovery and exploration. Donâ€™t forget to like, share, and subscribe to Dinesh A Pathum for more exciting adventures to come!

Greetings 
I am Dinesh#travel #kirindiella

title: à¶¯à·’à¶ºà·€à·’à¶±à·’ à¶‡à¶½à·Šà¶½ | Exploring the Majestic Diyavini Ella Falls | Peaceful Camping| à¶±à·à¶±à·Šà¶± à¶­à·’à¶ºà·™à¶± à¶±à·’à¶ºà¶¸ à¶­à·à¶±à¶šà·Š
description:
à¶¸à·„ à·€à·à·ƒà·Šà·ƒà¶­à·Š à¶‘à¶šà·Šà¶š à·ƒà¶šà·Šâ€à¶»à·“à¶º à·€à·”à¶±à·” à¶¯à·’à¶º à¶‡à¶½à·’ à·ƒà·œà¶ºà·à¶œà·™à¶± à¶œà·’à¶º à·ƒà¶‚à¶ à·à¶»à¶ºà·š à¶­à·€à¶­à·Š à¶‘à¶šà·Š à¶´à¶»à·’à¶ à·Šà¶¢à·šà¶¯à¶ºà¶šà·Š.

à¶†à¶ºà·”à¶¶à·à·€à¶±à·Š à¶¸à¶¸ à¶¯à·’à¶±à·šà·‚à·Š

Welcome back to another adventure .Today, weâ€™re starting our day surrounded by the serene beauty of Belihuloya, where natureâ€™s calmness sets the perfect tone for what lies ahead. After a quick tea and snack, we packed up our campsite and set off on an exciting journey to discover Diyavini Ella Falls.

Nestled in the Kaltota area of Balangoda, this breathtaking 60-meter-high waterfall is a true gem of Sri Lanka. Join us as we explore its majestic beauty, from its cascading heights to the peaceful spot at its base. Take a moment to pause and appreciate life, for it is as fleeting as the mist from these falls.

Letâ€™s dive into this adventure, and I hope you enjoy every moment of this video!

Greetings 
I am Dinesh

title: Ravana Falls | A Rainy Adventure to the Top of Ravana Falls | à¶»à·à·€à¶«à· à¶‡à¶½à·Šà¶½ à¶¸à·”à¶¯à·”à¶±à·š à·ƒà·”à¶±à·Šà¶¯à¶»à¶­à·Šà·€à¶º à·ƒà·œà¶ºà·
description:
Ravana Falls, nestled in the heart of Ella, is a true gem of Sri Lankaâ€™s highlands. This magnificent three-tiered waterfall tumbles from a height of over 80 feet, weaving its way through lush greenery and rocky cliffs. During the rainy season, it transforms into a roaring cascade, its waters shimmering like liquid silver against the backdrop of emerald foliage. The sound of the falls, a rhythmic thunder, echoes through the valley, creating an ambiance that is both exhilarating and calming.

On this day, the rain brought the falls to life, with the mist from the water rising into the air and blending seamlessly with the rain clouds. The climb to the top was an adventure of its ownâ€”drenched in rain, surrounded by the earthy scent of wet rocks and forest. By evening, the atmosphere turned surreal. A veil of mist softened the edges of the surrounding hills, and the setting sun painted the sky with hues of pink, orange, with different shades . The play of light and mist gave the scene an almost otherworldly glow, leaving us in awe of natureâ€™s raw, untamed beauty. I hope you will enjoy the upper Ravana falls. 

Greetings,
I am Dinesh

Join us as we camp in the misty pine forests of Walapane, where tall trees were hidden in thick fog and heavy rain. The fresh, earthy scent of wet pine needles filled the air as we cooked warm, comforting meals and enjoyed hot tea to keep us cozy. The rain created a peaceful atmosphere, and as the night passed, the morning greeted us with clear skies, crisp air, and the beauty of a forest refreshed by the rain. It was a magical escape surrounded by natureâ€™s raw beauty. I hope you will enjoy the video

I am Dinesh

Experience the untouched beauty and quiet majesty of Ohiya, a hidden village in the heart of Badulla district. For two nights, we found ourselves embraced by Ohiyaâ€™s misty air, blanketed by cool mountain breezes that carried a soothing stillness. The silence here isnâ€™t empty; itâ€™s filled with the gentle whispers of the wind through trees, the distant murmur of flowing streams, and the soft rustle of leaves underfoot.

Camping here was more than just an escapeâ€”it was a return to natureâ€™s purest moments. We cooked our meals over an open flame, savoring every bite under a star-filled sky, warmed by the comforting glow of the campfire. In the early hours, a calm quiet hung over the valley, broken only by the gentle song of birds at dawn, each note adding a delicate symphony to the silence.

Braving a swim in the crisp, cold water nearby was both exhilarating and grounding, a reminder of natureâ€™s power and beauty. This is Ohiyaâ€”an oasis of peace, where every moment brings you closer to the quiet wonders of the wild. Join us on this journey to a place where the silence speaks and nature reveals its soul.

Imagine waking up in the heart of Galapitayaya, a secluded paradise hidden within lush, untouched landscapes. As dawn breaks, the estate is cloaked in a soft, ethereal mist, wrapping everything in a sense of mystery and wonder. The world around you is silent, save for the gentle, melodic calls of birds announcing the arrival of a new day.

Galapitiyawa isnâ€™t just a place; itâ€™s an experience. This privately owned estate offers a unique blend of tranquility and raw, natural beauty. With every turn, youâ€™ll discover breathtaking viewpoints and hidden waterfalls cascading down rock faces into pristine pools. The air is crisp and fresh, carrying the subtle aroma of the forest, while the greenery stretches as far as the eye can see.

As you explore, each path invites you deeper into the serenity of this magical land. The waterfalls seem almost secretive, tucked away like natureâ€™s own treasure troves, waiting for only the most adventurous souls to uncover their beauty. Galapitiyawa isnâ€™t just a destination; itâ€™s an escape into natureâ€™s purest form, a place that will leave you in awe and inspire you to reconnect with the world around you.

So pack your bags, let go of the noise, and come lose yourself in the misty mornings, tranquil sounds, and untouched beauty of Galapitayaya.

Welcome to the Young Eye on Nature and Kin Wild exhibition, a breathtaking showcase of nature and wildlife photography and art. Organized by the Young Zoologistsâ€™ Association of Sri Lanka, this annual event highlights the stunning beauty and diversity of wildlife through the eyes of talented young photographers and artists. From November 1st to 3rd, 2024, at the JDA Perera Gallery in Colombo, immerse yourself in the untamed wilderness of Sri Lanka and beyond. This exhibition not only celebrates the artistic expression of nature but also raises awareness about wildlife conservation and the importance of preserving our natural heritage. Join us as we explore the wonders of the wild through captivating imagery and creativity.â€

title: Bird  Limestone Cave | waterfalls & Tea plantations in Vietnam | à·„à·”à¶«à·”à¶œà¶½à·Š à¶œà·”à·„à·à·€à¶šà·’à¶±à·Š  à·„à·”à¶«à·”à¶œà¶½à·Š à¶‡à¶½à·Šà¶½à¶šà¶§.
description:
The last and ongoing episode features the world's longest-bottomed glass bridge in Vietnam. The video showcases the stunning beauty of an active limestone cave located at the end of the glass bridge. The limestone cave is truly breathtaking, and I highly recommend adding it to your bucket list. Additionally, there's a breathtaking waterfall situated six kilometres away, from the glass bridge with crystal-clear water flowing through limestone. After visiting the waterfall, the video will take you to a tea plantation and a farm, offering an extraordinary experience. The location of the tea plantation is absolutely breathtaking. I hope you'll enjoy the video and the incredible experiences it captures.

Greetings,
I am Dinesh

title: World Longest Glass Bridge | à¶½à·à¶šà¶ºà·š à¶¯à·’à¶œà¶¸ à·€à·“à¶¯à·”à¶»à·” à¶´à·à¶½à¶¸ à¶‹à¶©à·’à¶±à·Š | Bach Long bridge,Vietnam.#worldrecord
description:
World Longest Glass Bridge.

The Bach Long Bridge, also known as the White Dragon Bridge, is the longest glass bridge in the world. It is located in Moc Chau, Vietnam, and spans a deep valley. 

The bridge is 632 metres long and 2.4 meters wide. It is made of high-strength glass and can support up to 450 people at a time.

The bridge was opened to the public in 2022 and has quickly become a popular tourist destination. 

Visitors can walk across the bridge, take photos, and enjoy the stunning views of the surrounding valley.

The bridge is made of three layers of high-strength glass, which is 40 millimetres thick. The glass is also treated with a special coating to make it more resistant to scratches and damage.

Greetings,
I am Dinesh.

à¶†à¶ºà·”à¶¶à·à·€à¶±à·Š à¶¸à¶¸ à¶¯à·’à¶±à·šà·‚à·Š.

This is the second episode of my unforgettable trip to Vietnam.

After spending a few days exploring the capital city of Vietnam, Hanoi, I joined an organized tour to visit Ninh Binh, the ancient capital of Vietnam.

Ninh Binh mesmerized me from the moment I arrived. The magical landscape with limestone mountains of different shapes added a unique beauty to the area. I embarked on a bamboo boat and peacefully rowed along the gentle water. After a few minutes, we reached a grotto that still had active limestones. I was amazed by the landscape, featuring five to six caves. I must mention that the movie King Kong was filmed in this area, and without any doubt, it's a perfect location for a movie.

Our second stop was the Mua Cave, also known as the Vietnamese "Great Wall of China." The hike was challenging, but reaching the top felt like entering a magical world.

All of these experiences will be shared in my next video. I hope you will enjoy it.

Greetings,
I am Dinesh.

title: Hanoi Train Street | Vietnam | à·€à·’à¶ºà¶§à·Šà¶±à·à¶¸à·Š à·ƒà¶‚à¶ à·à¶»à¶ºà·š à¶…à¶¸à¶­à¶š à¶±à·œà·€à¶± à¶…à¶­à·Šà¶¯à·à¶šà·“à¶¸ | #vietnam #hanoitrainstreet
description:
I am thrilled to share the first video from my Vietnam tour with you. The journey began in the captivating city of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam. Hanoi is a bustling city with an array of attractions and vibrant markets to explore. One of the most memorable experiences for me was visiting the train street, where visitors gathered around small chairs beside the railway track to watch the train passing by while enjoying a meal or a drink. The feeling of the train passing just inches away is truly unforgettable.

During my time in Hanoi, I also visited a war museum and memorial, as well as a prison, which provided a deeply moving and eye-opening experience. To conclude my day, I wandered through the old market street and savored a delightful Vietnamese meal at a renowned restaurant in Hanoi.

I have immortalized these moments in the video and I hope that you will find joy in watching it.

Greetings,
I am Dinesh

à¶†à¶ºà·”à¶¶à·à·€à¶±à·Š à¶¸à¶¸ à¶¯à·’à¶±à·šà·à·Š
(à¶ºà·à¶½ à·à·Šâ€à¶»à¶¸ à¶¯à·à¶±à¶º à·ƒà¶¯à·„à· à·ƒà·„à¶·à·à¶œà·“ à·€à·– à¶­à·€à¶­à·Š à¶‘à¶šà·Š à·ƒà·à¶¸à·à¶¢à·’à¶šà¶ºà·™à¶šà·Š)

I was fortunate to have the opportunity to collaborate with the Sri Lankan Wild Life Department and Yala National Park authorities to organize a significant event. Over 50 young people joined us in a clean-up campaign following a foot pilgrimage. For two days, we worked together to collect polythene and plastic waste. What truly made this event special was the incredible sense of teamwork and the powerful message we were able to share with the community.

Greetings,
I am Dinesh

title: à¶´à·à¶¯ à¶ºà·à¶­à·Šâ€à¶»à·à·€ 2024 | Community Feast for Katharagama Pada Yatra  à¶´à·à¶¯ à¶ºà·à¶­à·Šâ€à¶»à·à·€à·š à¶šà·œà¶¸à¶©à·” à¶¯à¶±à·Šà·ƒà·à¶½ #yala
description:
This time, our friends organized a heartwarming community feast to honour the participants of the Sri Lankan longest-foot pilgrimage. Together with my friends, we bought almost 300kg of watermelons and shared them with the pilgrims at Yala National Park. The event was truly a beautiful coming together of the community, and it was incredibly moving to be a part of it. I hope you'll find the video touching and uplifting.

Greetings,
I am Dinesh

description:
à¶šà·œà¶»à·’à¶ºà·à·€à·š à¶­à·’à¶ºà¶± à¶½à·ƒà·Šà·ƒà¶±à¶¸ à¶´à·à¶»à¶«à·’ à¶œà¶¸à·Šà¶¸à·à¶±à¶ºà¶šà·Š à·€à¶± à¶ à·œà¶±à·Šà¶ à·” à·„à¶±à·œà¶šà·Š à¶œà¶¸à·Šà¶¸à·à¶±à¶º à¶¸à¶¸ à¶œà·’à¶ºà¶´à·” à¶šà·œà¶»à·’à¶ºà·à·€à·š à¶­à·’à¶ºà¶± à¶½à·ƒà·Šà·ƒà¶±à¶¸ à¶­à·à¶±à¶šà·Š à¶šà·œà¶»à·’à¶ºà·à·€à·š à¶…à¶­à·’à¶­à¶º à¶½à·ƒà·Šà·ƒà¶±à¶§ à¶±à·à·€à¶­ à¶´à·Šâ€à¶»à¶­à·’à·ƒà¶‚à·ƒà·Šà¶šà¶»à¶«à¶º à¶šà¶»à¶½à· à·ƒà¶‚à¶ à·à¶»à¶šà¶ºà¶±à·Š à·€à·ƒà·“ à¶šà¶»à·€à¶± à¶¸à·š à¶œà¶¸à·Šà¶¸à·à¶±à¶º à¶¶à¶½à¶±à·Šà¶± à¶”à¶ºà·à¶½à¶­à·Š à¶‘à¶šà¶­à·” à·€à·™à¶±à·Šà¶±   

Jeonju Hanok Village The City of Jeonju has played a key role in the long history of Korea. The city was once the capital of the Hubaekje Kingdom, which was founded by Gyeon Hwon in the 900s.4 The city was regarded as the spiritual capital of the Joseon Dynasty because the Yi royal family was from there. In the Joseon Dynasty, Jeonju governed the Jeolla-do area along with Jeju Island, which was considered the center of administration. This is why the city is called 'the ground of more than 1000 years history.4] People first settled in the Jeonju area over 10,000 years ago. At first, people lived around the foot of a mountain. Then, in the Silla kingdom, people moved into the flat land surrounding the mountain. People in Jeonju began constructing the city's defensive wall and many villages naturally formed around the city. These villages were the beginning of the current Hanok village. After the demolition of the Jeonju's city wall during the Korean Empire period, the residential area within the wall began to expand throughout the Pungnam-dong and Gyo-dong districts led by the Yangban. The village has become one of the most popular tourist attractions of Jeonju.
